page.title: 16PAISLEY GRAMMAR SCHOOL
page.content:
Paisley Grammar is one of the oldest schools in Scotland. 'The Grammar' was founded in 1576 by royal charter although it took 10 years to erect a school building. Thus we celebrate 400 years of continuous educational provision in 1986. Great changes have taken place in the last 20 years. Paisley Grammar is no longer a fee-paying establishment with a primary department, but is now a fully comprehensive secondary school.
At a time when most school rolls are falling, the school is filled to capacity - 940 pupils. This is due in part to a large number of parent requests for their children to attend the school in preference to their local schools. The Grammar has a reputation for high academic standards and activities like music and sport.
